title: RTI: Quest Begins
description: Learn what the Right to Information is and how it helps you ask questions.
learningGoals: Know that any citizen can ask for information
Know that government must reply within 30 days

video.transcript: Hi! I'm Priya. Have you ever wondered why the government does what it does? ...
keyPoints: RTI is a law that lets citizens ask the government for information.
The government must answer within 30 days.
RTI is simple and for everyone.

games.title: What is RTI?
games.instructions: Pick the correct answer based on the video.

questions.q: What does RTI allow you to do?
questions.explanation: RTI gives you the right to ask for information from public authorities.

feedback.onSuccess: Nice! You remember what RTI is.
feedback.onFail: Watch the video again and try once more.

games.title: RTI in 4 Steps
games.instructions: Arrange the steps in the correct order.

feedback.onSuccess: Perfect! You know how RTI works now.
feedback.onFail: Almost there. Think about what comes first and last.

content.scenarioText: Your city park is being removed for a mall, and nobody explains why.

options.text: Use RTI to ask the municipal office why the decision was taken.
options.explanation: Municipal bodies are public authorities, so you can use RTI.

options.text: Do nothing because you are a child.
options.explanation: Children can also seek information with help from adults.

feedback.onSuccess: Great choice! RTI helps you understand public decisions.
feedback.onFail: Think again: RTI is for understanding government actions.

legalReference.notes: Citizens have the right to information and public authorities must reply within 30 days.
